abstract: Selling off Peroni and Grolsch could bring $1.2 billion for the combined Anheuser-Busch InBev and SABMiller and ease antitrust approval.
snippet: Selling off Peroni and Grolsch could bring $1.2 billion for the combined Anheuser-Busch InBev and SABMiller and ease antitrust approval.
lead_paragraph: Anheuser-Busch InBev has barely concluded its $106 billion deal to buy SABMiller and now is planning its next deal: a sale of Peroni and Grolsch, which it will acquire in the SAB deal. SAB’s dregs might attract a rival, but a private buyer may find those brands more to its taste.

headline.main: Huge Beer Merger’s Cast-Offs Could Attract a Private Buyer
